channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: At Target, we believe retail’s next great disruptor is emotion. Look no further than this year’s winter wonderland
item.description: For the first time, we'll have weekly events in stores all season. For Black Friday, we’ll have giveaways for the first 100 shoppers at all of our sto...

item.title: SNAP Recipients Plan Thanksgiving, Down to Their Last Cent
item.description: Mary Schiely relies on SNAP benefits, as do many customers at the small grocery store where she works. The nation’s day of feasting is not the easiest...

item.title: Apple yanked a brand-new TV show just days before it was scheduled to air amid allegations of plagiarism
item.description: Reports say Apple was unaware of the similarities between its show "The Hunt" and Douglas Fairbairn's novel, "Shoot," throughout development.

item.title: Venezuela’s Nobel Peace Prize Winner Pushes False Claims About Maduro
item.description: Opposition leader Maria Corina Machado faces criticism that she is exaggerating threats posed by Venezuela’s leader to justify U.S. force to overthrow...

item.title: Canada cozies up to India for trade deal after years of strain as Trump continues pushing the world into new alliances
item.description: Canada is also seeking better relations with Beijing, holding a meeting at the Asia-Pacific summit last month.

item.title: ‘It wasn’t worth the $10 tariff for a $27 purchase’: American shoppers find maybe they just won’t buy that small thing from Canada or England this year
item.description: Getting rid of the so-called de minimis exemption was meant to curb drug trafficking and stop low-quality goods flooding the U.S. market.

item.title: Missing High School Coach Travis Turner Facing Charges, Officials Say
item.description: An Appalachian community in Virginia was electrified by its high school team’s winning streak. Until the team’s coach disappeared — and allegations ag...

item.title: ICE agents using AI ‘may explain the inaccuracy of these reports,’ judge writes, noting a body cam video shows an agent asking ChatGPT for help
item.description: The judge noted factual discrepancies between the official narrative about those law enforcement responses and what body camera footage showed.

item.title: The Race for Mikie Sherrill’s House Seat Is On, and It’s Crowded
item.description: The dozen candidates include an activist endorsed by Bernie Sanders, New Jersey’s lieutenant governor and an ousted congressman running in a new distr...

item.title: Heavy Snow Forecast Across Wisconsin and Minnesota
item.description: Forecasters said the storm was expected to be unusually intense, even for areas used to heavy snow.

item.title: Live Updates: At Least 13 Are Killed as Fire Engulfs Hong Kong Apartments
item.description: Firefighters were still trying to extinguish the blaze at an apartment complex in the city’s northern Tai Po district.

item.title: Deadly Flooding in Thailand Prompts Rescues and Evacuations
item.description: The military sent troops, helicopters and boats to rescue stranded people. At least 33 people have been killed and more than two million displaced ove...

item.title: The last time Hong Kong had a major fire was 2008.
item.description: The last five-alarm fire in Hong Kong engulfed a 15-story building in the Mong Kong district, killing four people.

item.title: Pope Leo Blesses Rave-Goers in Slovakia
item.description: A papal video message appeared before a crowd of hundreds, as Guilherme Peixoto, a priest who doubles as an electronic D.J., put on a show.

item.title: Here’s the latest.
item.description: Firefighters were struggling to bring the blaze under control in a densely populated complex in the city’s northern Tai Po district hours after it sta...
